reviewText: More of an ad for train layouts than a guide in aiding design of a new layout.  How to design inclines and include them in planning a new layout should be in this (at least Part2)
So many helpful tips, if you are building a small layout or an intire room, this book has lots of useful ideas.  Expecally if you are using older parts bought off on line auctions
My dad loved the dvd because he is really into the Lionel Trains; the rest of us however, found the video to be tedious and poorly made
Sets my mind buzzing with ideas for setting up my own layout. Now if only I could find the money to help me fulfill my dreams..........
It makes me cry to look at these Parts. I had soooo many Lionel Trains as a child. So it gives me GREAT JOY to watch these parts. I really enjoy them.

I am a fan of Tom McCombas's collection of Lionel and toy train videos.  This one is a bit dry because the interviews become lengthy with some weird edits.  Primarily bought it for my son's obsession with toy trains but ended up enjoying more for myself.  If you are fascinated by toy trains and their collectors this is a good see.
The DVD was good in that it showed that there are some extreme layouts out there.  I was a little disappointed in that it didn't show how they were built/ constructed.
This was a gift to my husband the train geek.  He loved it.  One of his favorite gifts.

I'm sure I can not top previous reviews, but I have watched and re watched this DVD more than any other DVD I have rented or now own.

If this video doesn't inspire you to start buying some of those old Lionel trains we had as Kids nothing will.

Lionel would be proud of me ! I have bought 3 books on collecting and spent atleast $1000.00 in the last month buying some of those old Lionel Train keepsakes and more.

I'm now planning my own railroad since watching the video and I am also trying to find a local 3 rail club. Hopefully one exists in Central California.

You wil enjoy this video! I'm now looking for another copy to share with a friend.

I have found Amazon a great place to look for what you want.
Dad and I watched them together... priceless!
Seth Geim's Train Barn in Portage, MI, closed on April 21, 2012. Geim passed away September 11, 2015. So now videos such as Part 2 are the only way to see the wonderful layout he created.
arrived on time, good dream layout. .  will pass to others
A fascinating look at american model trains in their heyday and this DVD shows some lovely layouts to drool over.
Cannot beat the footage and material for the price. Fun having this running at Christmas just to add some atmosphere. Some good bits of info for the serious collector, but over all it is just fun.
My Grandson loved this, it was reasonably priced and we received it before Christmas, however, I don't believe he has watched it.
